moves.1. e4: Standard opening, grabing some of the center.
moves.1... e5: Have to counter to help control.
moves.2... Nc6: Have to protect my pawn on e5
moves.3. Bc4: Develop a piece and attack the weak f7 pawn, also can castle on next move.
moves.3... Nf6: Bringing out the knight to attack the e4 pawn or prepares me to push my pawn to d5.
moves.4. d3: Protecting the e4 pawn as well as opening up for the c1 bishop.
moves.5... Bc5: Develop the bishop and allow me to castle the next move.
moves.6. Re1: Bringing the rook into play, while knight and bishop remain undeveloped.
moves.7. Nc3: Develop and prevent me from moving pawn to d5
moves.7... d6: Last move allowed me to only move one instead of 2.  But have to develop my bishop on c8.
moves.8. Be3: Devloping the bishop with a threat and if captured, opens up the file file.
moves.8... Bb6: Capture does not benifit me.  Would rather my opponent capture so I can open up the a file.
moves.9. a3: Not sure of this move, but might be thinking of a queen side assult with pawns.
moves.9... Be6: Develop a bishop with a threat.
moves.10... fxe6: Capture it back, have another pawn in the middle and an open f file.
moves.11. h3: Pull the pawn to keep knight from going to g4.
moves.11... Rf7: Getting ready to double on the f file.
moves.12. Nb5: Hoping for an h7- h6 pawn move so I have double pawns on the b file.
moves.12... d5: This move is to undouble my pawns on the e file.
moves.13. Nd2: Not sure about this move as it leaves his bishop no save place.
moves.14. Bxd4: take something with it as it is lost.
moves.15. c3: Not sure here as the knight on b5 in undefended.  A better move would of been to capture or pull back to c3.
moves.16. Nf3: Opening space for the queen and also placing the knight in a spot to play defence or jump into the action.
moves.16... Nd7: Have to protect the e5 pawn and also getting ready to double on the f file.
moves.19... Bxf2+: Have to take something and open up the board.  ALso a pin upcoming!!
moves.21. Kg1: good move, un pins the knight
moves.22. Re3: bringing some help to the knight
moves.22... Raf8: putting more heat on the knight
moves.23. Qe2: looking to make room for the rook on f1
moves.23... Nb5: bringing in more help with the knight looking to move to c3 next move
moves.24. d4: Seen it and good move to boot as it cause all sorts of problems for me
moves.24... exd4: put heat on the rook and leave knight for bait.
moves.25. cxd4: Heat still on knight and recaptures the lost pawn
moves.26. Rd3: protecting the d4 pawn and still protecting the knight
moves.26... e5: looking the bring my other knight into play
moves.27. Nxe5: good move as both my loose knight on d7 and queen under attack
moves.27... Nxd4: so put his queen under attack as well.  If my queen captured with rook, I have a nice king rook fork.
moves.28. Rxd4: takes the knight as he seen the upcoming fork.
moves.29. Rdd1: not sure here, but not many options left.
moves.29... Nf3+: 2 king moves here, h1 is checkmate, f8 is discovered check.  Queen can capture but is lost right away.
moves.30. Kf1: Move the knight and take the queen in a move
moves.30... Nd4+: move the queen in front or go back to g1 with king
moves.31. Kg1: G1 and then a check to boot
moves.33. Rde1: g1 would have prolonged, but only a few moves
